extension.summary: Change what HDR10 metadata is sent to your TV
extension.description:
Specifically, but not exclusively, made for fixing LG 2017 OLEDs' (B7, C7, E7) tone mapping: LG updated their firmware and broke HDR10 tone mapping under multiple conditions (see https://www.avsforum.com/forum/139-display-calibration/2853954-lg-2017-oled-calibration-thread-settings-108.html#post59054246). This addon automatically overrides the HDR10 metadata sent to the TV to trick it into using a tonemapping curve that follows the actual PQ-EOTF more closely. Overall, this will provide an image that is less dim and avoids overbrightened highlights and black crush for most movies.
Active HDR should be disabled (Dynamic Contrast: Off) on your LG 2017. Slight highlight clipping for movies with 2000+ nits scenes is unavoidable.
Only works on Vero 4K/4K+ devices, tested with kernel 3.14 (and OSMC 2019.11-1).
